answers.answer: HiThere are many causes of loss of bladder control. Your daughter is probably having stress incontinence caused by “certain activities like coughing, sneezing, laughing, or exercise” or any cause that puts pressure on the bladder. Please refer: http://www.umm.edu/ency/article/003142.htm  and  http://www.fda.gov/WOMENS/getthefacts/bladderControl.htmlYou may also get her blood tested for diabetes and hypothyroidism. If she is overweight and/or remains constipated, then also she can get this kind of problem.Hope this helps. If you need more help, please feel free to contact. I’ll be happy to answer your queries. Please keep me posted.

question: My 12 year old daughter who is in good health has problems with holding her urine if she hits her butt or tailbone.  If she is wrestling around with her brothers and falls on her butt on the ground she runs to the bathroom or she pees herself.  It happened to her yesterday at her friends house while she was getting ready to go to church with her friends family.  She hit her tailbone on the door jamb (or something like it) and peed herself.  I am not talking just a dribble, I am meaning it ran down both legs and puddled on the floor.  How do I approach a doctor to discuss this?  What are some POSSIBLE (I understand without seeing her file, you know) causes?
title: 12 year old daughter pees when she hits her butt (tailbone)
